com.codepoetics.fluvius.api

Interface Flow<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of value returned by the flow.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface Flow<T>
extends Serializable
    A Flow which takes values from a Scratchpad, and provides a new value to be written into the Scratchpad.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<Flow<?>> getAllFlows()
      Flatten this flow into a list of flows.
      Key<T> getProvidedKey()
      Get the Key that this Flow will write into the Scratchpad.
      Set<Key<?>> getRequiredKeys()
      Get the required Keys that this Flow expects to find in the Scratchpad.
      Flow<T> orIf(Condition condition, Flow<T> ifTrue)
      Create a branching Flow, with this Flow as the default branch and the supplied Condition and Flow as the first conditional branch.
      <N> Flow<N> then(Flow<N> next)
      Combine this Flow with a subsequent Flow to create a sequence of Flows.

    • Method Detail

      • getRequiredKeys

        Set<Key<?>> getRequiredKeys()
        Get the required Keys that this Flow expects to find in the Scratchpad.
        Returns:
        The required Keys that this Flow expects to find in the Scratchpad.

      • getProvidedKey

        Key<T> getProvidedKey()
        Get the Key that this Flow will write into the Scratchpad.
        Returns:
        The key that this Flow will write into the Scratchpad.

      • visit

        <V> V visit(FlowVisitor<V> visitor)
        Convert this Flow into a value of some kind (e.g. an Action) by visiting it (and all of its sub-flows) with the supplied FlowVisitor.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of the value constructed by the FlowVisitor.
        Parameters:
        visitor - The FlowVisitor to visit this Flow (and all of its sub-flows) with.
        Returns:
        The value constructed by the FlowVisitor.

      • then

        <N> Flow<N> then(Flow<N> next)
        Combine this Flow with a subsequent Flow to create a sequence of Flows.
        Type Parameters:
        N - The type of value returned by the next Flow in the sequence (and hence the type of the new sequence of Flows).
        Parameters:
        next - The Flow to run after this Flow.
        Returns:
        The constructed Flow.

      • orIf

        Flow<T> orIf(Condition condition,
             Flow<T> ifTrue)
        Create a branching Flow, with this Flow as the default branch and the supplied Condition and Flow as the first conditional branch. If this Flow is already a branching Flow, then the supplied Condition and Flow are used to add another conditional branch to it.
        Parameters:
        condition - The Condition to test to determine whether to execute the supplied Flow.
        ifTrue - The Flow to execute if the Condition is met.
        Returns:
        The constructed Flow.

      • getAllFlows

        List<Flow<?>> getAllFlows()
        Flatten this flow into a list of flows.
        Returns:
        A list of flows containing either this flow, or (if this flow is a sequence) all of the flows in this flow.
